column4: I completely hosed my system, I tried reinstalling and it overwrote important data. I don't want that to happen next time I decide to reinstall linux, so is there a guide to setting up usr and home on separate partitions?
I am installing Ubuntu onto a 230GB part of the drive
/etc is for all your system settings, is that what you were thinking of?
All my installed applications are gone, etc
I don't want that next time
I just dont want my stuff uninstalled next time I ever have to reinstall the OS
its too late, it already killed everything
it would be pretty tough to keep all your installed programs after doing a reinstall, that's kind of the point
I had important stuff installed, such as MySQL, etc
So I lost all my databases
how about /var then, that would save that stuff
I don't want that to happen next time
you'd still have to reinstall mysql, but the databases themselves are in /var
Ok, so that is what I need on a separate partition
I would think 2-3 GB would be more than sufficient (mostly because apt stores all your downloaded packages there as well)
